gurmukhi: nMd jsodh kiRSn imil Aiq icq mY suK pwie ]sBY gopkw ijh huqI qh hI phucy jwie ]2420]
transliteration: Nand Jasodah Krishan Mil(i) At(i) Chit Mai Soukh Paae|| Sabhai Gopkaa Jih Houtitah Hipahouche Jaae||2420||
translation: Nand, Yashoda and Krihsna, getting extreme happiness in their minds, reached at the place, where all the gopis were standing.2420.

gurmukhi: sRI biRjnwQh ko jb hI liK kY iqh gÍwrn Awgm pwXo ]Awgy hI eyk clI auT kY nih eykn ey aur AwnMd mwXo ]
transliteration: Sribrijnaathah Ko Jab Hilakh(i) Kai Tih Gvaaran Aagad Paayo|| Ooge Hiek Chaliouth Kai Nah(i) Ekan E Ur Aanand Maayo||
translation: When the gopis saw Krishna coming and one of them got up and went forward and the delight welled up in the minds of many;

gurmukhi: ByK mlIn jy guAwr huqI iqn ByK nvIn sjy kib gwXo ]mwnhu miRqk jwg auTXo iqn ky qn mY bhuro jIA AwXo ]2421]
transliteration: Bhekh Maleen Je Guaar Houtitin Bhekh Naveen Saje Kabi Gadyo|| Maanoh Mritak Jaag Outhyo Tin Ke Tan Mai Bahuro Jeea Aayo||2421||
translation: The newness came on the gopis wearing unclean garbs as if some dead one had risen again and had got another lease of life.2421.

gurmukhi: XO iek BwKq hY muK qy imil gÍwrn sRI biRjnwQ icqY kY ]jau AkRUr ky sMg gey cV sXMdn nwQ hulws bFY kY ]
transliteration: Yau Ik Bhaakhat Hai Moukh Te Mil(i) Gvaaran Sribrijnaath Chitai Kai|| Jau Akroor Ke San Gad Chad Syandan Naath Hulaas Badhai Kai||
translation: One of the gopis said on seeing Krishna, “Since the time, when Krishna delightfully went with Akrur, mounting on his chariot,

gurmukhi: dUr hulws kIXo biRj qy kCu guAwrn kI krnwnih kY kY ]eyk khY ieh BwNiq sKI muK jovq eyk rhI cup hÍY kY ]2422]
transliteration: Door Hulaas Keeyo Brij Te Kachh(u) Guaaran Kikarnaanah(i) Kai Kai|| Ek Kahai Eh Bhaant(i) Sakhimoukh Jovat Ek Rahichoup Hvai Kai||2422||
translation: From that time he has relinquished his kindness towards the gopis and thus finished the pleasure of Braja; someone is talking like this and someone is standing silently.2422.

gurmukhi: sRI biRjnwQ gXo mQurw kCu ic`q ibKY sKI hyq n DwrXo ]nYk n moh kIXo ic`q mY inrmoh hI Awpn ic`q ibcwrXo ]
transliteration: Sribrijnaath Gado Mathuraa Kachhu Chitt Bikhai Sakhihet Na Dhaarryo|| Naik Na Moh Keeyo Chitt Mai Nirmoh Hiaapan Chitt Bichdaryo||
translation: “O friend ! Krishna has gone to Matura; he has never thought about us with love; he had not even the slightest attachment for us and he became unkind in his mind;

gurmukhi: XO biRjnwiek gÍwr qjI jsu qw Cb ko kib sXwm aucwrXo ]AwpnI caupih qy ApnI mwno kuMjih iqAwg BujMg isDwrXo ]2423]
transliteration: Yau Brijnaaik Gvaar Tajijas(u) Taa Chhab Ko Kabi Syaam Ouchdaryo|| Oopanichaoupah(i) Te Apnimaano Kounjah(i) Tiaag Bhujan Sidhdaryo||2423||
translation: Krishna has forsaken the gopis like the snake going away leaving behind his slough.”2423.

gurmukhi: cMdRBgw biRKBwn suqw biRjnwiek kau ieh BwNiq sunweI ]sRI biRjnwQ gey mQurw qij ky biRj pRIq sBY ibsrweI ]
transliteration: Channdrabhagad Brikhbhaan Soutaa Brijnaaik Kau Eh Bhaant(i) Sudaaee|| Sribrijnaath Gad Mathuraa Taj(i) Ke Brij Preet Sabhai Bisraaee||
translation: Chandarbhaga and Radha said this to Krishna, “Krishna, relinquishing his attachment for Braja, has gone to Mathura,

gurmukhi: rwiDkw jw ibD mwn kIXo hir qYsy hI mwn kIXo jIA AweI ]qw idn ky ibCury ibCury su deI hm kau Ab Awn idKweI ]2424]
transliteration: Raadhikaa Jaa Bidh Maan Keeyo Har(i) Taise Himaan Keeyo Jeea Aaee|| Taa Din Ke Bichure Bichure Su Daiham Kau Ab Aan Dikhaaee||2424||
translation: “The way in which Radha had exhibited her pride, Krishna also thought that he should also do the same; we are seeing each other now after having been separated for a long time.”2424.
